IntroSection.title: Hi, I am Matthieu, a passionate front-end developer.
IntroSection.description: I invite you to discover my portfolio.

AboutSection.title: About me
AboutSection.subTitle: Who is Matthieu?
AboutSection.description: Hi! My name is Matthieu Bonjour. I have made a career change and obtained my professional certification equivalent to a 2-year degree with OpenClassrooms.
AboutSection.description2: After spending a few years in retail, particularly at Cash Express and Darty where I sold, bought, and tested numerous multimedia products, TVs, and various other items, I decided to change my career path.
AboutSection.description3: I am now officially a web developer.
AboutSection.description4: I take great pleasure in learning new languages and integrating them.
AboutSection.description5: I am motivated, passionate about what I do, and eager to learn more. Feel free to contact me if you are looking for someone with my profile. I would be delighted to meet your expectations and join a team.

2024.text1: Actively seeking a junior position as a web integrator developer.
2024.text2: Integration into the DinoRPG community project.
2024.text3: Order preparer / delivery person at Floral Concept.

2023.text1: Web developer training with OpenClassrooms, obtaining my Bac +2 level certification.

2023-2019.text1: Experienced multimedia TV salesperson at Darty.

SkillsSection.title: Skills
SkillsSection.text: I work with the following technologies and tools:

project0.title: Riding Cities
project0.description: Project 2 of the OpenClassrooms Web Integrator course allows us to discover the fundamentals of HTML through the website of Riding Cities. Riding Cities is a fictional skateboarding association.

competences.1: Integrate elements on a web page using the fundamentals of HTML

project1.title: Booki
project1.description: Project 3 of the OpenClassrooms Web Integrator course allows us to integrate the interface of the Booki website using HTML and CSS.

competences.1: Set up a front-end development environment
competences.2: Implement a responsive interface with HTML and CSS
competences.3: Integrate content according to a mockup using HTML and CSS

project2.title: Ohmyfood
project2.description: Project 4 of the OpenClassrooms Web Integrator course consists of integrating the interface of the Ohmyfood website, starting with the mobile version.

competences.1: Integrate a design using a mobile-first approach
competences.3: Version control the project with Git and GitHub

project3.title: Print It
project3.description: Project 5 of the OpenClassrooms Web Integrator course allows us to discover the JavaScript language through the Print It website.

competences.1: Program using the fundamentals of JavaScript

project4.title: Portfolio - Sophie Bluel
project4.description: Project 6 of the OpenClassrooms Web Integrator course involves designing the portfolio website of an architect using JavaScript and communicating with an API.
project4.infos: If you wish to see the project, please follow the readme to launch the backend / frontend of the project.

competences.3: Retrieve user data in JavaScript via forms

project5.title: Menu Maker
project5.description: Project 7 of the OpenClassrooms Web Integrator course is different from the other projects; it involves planning the development of the next website for our client Qwenta.

competences.2: Write the technical specifications for a web project based on functional requirements
competences.3: Break down features into tasks to prepare for development
competences.5: Track the project's progress using a project management tool

project6.title: Kasa
project6.description: Project 8 of the OpenClassrooms Web Integrator course involves developing the new web platform for Kasa using React.

competences.1: Initialize an application with Create React App
competences.2: Configure navigation between the application's pages with React Router
competences.3: Develop interface elements of a website using React components
competences.5: Develop a web interface with Sass

project7.title: Nina Carducci
project7.description: Project 9 of the OpenClassrooms Web Integrator course involves improving the performance and SEO of a client's website.

competences.1: Optimize the performance of a website

project8.title: 724 events
project8.description: Project 10 of the Web Integrator course involves debugging the website of an event agency called 724events.

competences.1: Debug a website using Chrome DevTools
competences.2: Write a test plan to test a website

project9.title: Argent Bank
project9.description: Project 11 of the OpenClassrooms Web Integrator course involves implementing the front-end of a banking application: Argent Bank using React.
project9.infos: If you wish to see the project, please follow the readme to launch the backend / frontend of the project.

competences.1: Display backend data on the interface via API calls
competences.2: Configure API routes for client/server communication
competences.3: Implement data management with Redux to ensure the frontend's functionality

project10.title: Mon Portfolio
project10.description: Project 12, the final project of the OpenClassrooms Web Integrator course, involves creating and launching a personal portfolio website.
project10.infos: You can find the code of my old portfolio created during my training, you are currently on my new portfolio coded with Nextjs.

project11.title: Watowatch
project11.description: This project involves fetching all TV series from the TMDB external API. Each day, a new TV series suggestion is provided.
project11.infos: This site was written in English.

competences.1: Display backend data on the interface via API calls
competences.2: Configure API routes for client/server communication

project12.title: ISpent
project12.description: This project involves tracking your expenses. Simple and effective, you enter your income and expenses. It uses React-Redux to manage the store and Redux-Persist to keep your data in localStorage.
project12.infos: This site was written in English.

project13.title: Florence
project13.description: Creation of a landing page about the city of Florence.

competences.1: Implement an interface with HTML and CSS

project14.title: Rand'images
project14.description: Mini-project involving the creation of custom hooks.

competences.1: Manage state and effects in a React component using useState and useEffect hooks.
competences.2: Make asynchronous API calls with axios to fetch and display dynamic data.
competences.3: Create and use custom hooks to encapsulate and reuse logic, such as scroll detection.
competences.4: Integrate and structure React components for better code organization and modularity.
competences.5: Enhance user experience with loading state management and the use of CSS modules for styling.

project15.title: Zest
project15.description: Mini-project created during a recruitment process for a company. Zest is a mini social network based on a neumorphism style and responsive design.
project15.infos: No back-end is used for this project.

competences.1: Implement a neumorphic design using CSS to create a modern user interface
competences.2: Develop a responsive interface for various devices and screen sizes
competences.3: Structure application content with HTML and add interactivity using JavaScript
competences.4: Use Git and GitHub for version control and collaboration on the project

project30.title: My Current Portfolio
project30.description: For better SEO and easier readability for indexing bots, I decided to redevelop my portfolio using Next.js, following advice from my evaluator during my last project with OpenClassrooms.
project30.infos: You are currently browsing it ðŸ˜Š

competences.3: Internationale my portfolio in French and English with next-intl

project31.title: Eternal Twin - DinoRPG
project31.description: I joined a community open-source project to continue developing my skills, learn to work in a team, and discover new languages. I try to contribute to both the front-end and back-end parts of the project.

firstArticle.title: 1 - Site Edition:
firstArticle.paragraph: In accordance with the provisions of law no. 2004-575 of June 21, 2004, for confidence in the digital economy, it is specified to users of the website <websiteLink>http://matthieubonjour.dev</websiteLink>, the identity of the various stakeholders in the context of its implementation and monitoring.
firstArticle.paragraph2: This site, accessible at the URL <websiteLink>http://matthieubonjour.dev</websiteLink>, is edited by: Matthieu Bonjour, residing at 43 impasse de l'ancienne gendarmerie 83600 LES ADRETS DE L'ESTEREL.

secondArticle.title: 2 - Hosting:
secondArticle.paragraph: The site is hosted by Vercel Inc., located at 440 N Barranca Ave #4133 Covina, CA 91723, United States.

thirdArticle.title: 3 - CNIL, personal data management, cookies:
thirdArticle.paragraph: To date, the site does not collect any data from its users and does not cause the installation of any cookies on the user's computer.

NotFoundPage.errorDescription: Sorry, the page you are looking for does not exist.
